results.title: Pretty in pink
results.creator_credit: Howard Deutch, Lauren Shuler and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Andie (Molly Ringwald) is a girl of modest means, who may have to suffer the humiliation of having no date for the prom. She just wants to express herself through her eccentric fashion sense, but this does not sit well with her peers at the snob-ridden local high school. Pretty in Pink’ is a classic80s “teen flick”, which, to quote Adrian Martin, “sensitizes us to all that is modest, fleeting, fragile in popular cinema and popular culture”. Cast includes Molly Ringwald, Andrew McCarthy and Jon Cryer.

results.title: Sex and Zen II
results.creator_credit: Chin Man-Kei, Wong Jing and Golden Movies International
results.brief_description: A surreal, offbeat and lush sequel to the original cult classic, this is the farcical story of a man whose lascivious escapades lead to serious trouble. In the process of arranging a liason for his son, the hero becomes involved with the ‘Mirage Woman’, unaware that she is a pursued criminal who extracts the essence of all her sexual partners and kills them. With four wives and the pick of all the women in the country, has he finally met his match? This is a humourous and colourful saga that continues the notoriously explicit style of the original. In Cantonese with english subtitles.

results.title: The King of comedy
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures
results.brief_description: Rupert Pupkin (Robert De Niro), is an aspiring comedian obsessed with TV talk show host, Jerry Langford (Jerry Lewis). After co-ordinating a meeting with his idol, Rupert tells Langford about the comedy material he has written. Langford is as charming as he is dismissive, and after being repeatedly rejected and eventually ejected by Langford’s staff, Rupert decides to take matters into his own hands, conspiring a sensationally irresponsible scheme to beat defeat. The ‘King of Comedy’ is widely seen as Martin Scorsese’s cynically black-comic reaction to the media firestorm that followed his 1976 film ‘Taxi Driver’.

results.title: Blackrock
results.creator_credit: Steven Vidler, David Elfick, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The badly beaten, gang-raped corpse of a 15 year old girl is discovered on a deserted stretch of beach after an all-night beach party, celebrating the return of local surfing legend, Ricko, goes out of control. The working class Australian coastal community of Blackrock goes into an uproar, and is promptly splintered by shame, deceit and mistrust. 17 year old Jared (who organised Ricko’s party at the local surf club), is left with the wrenching decision whether or not to rat on his mates. Cast includes Laurence Breuls, Linda Cropper, Simon Lyndon, Chris Haywood, Rebecca Smart, Essie Davis and Jessica Napier.

results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

results.title: Fly away home
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Carol Baum, John Veitch and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: After the shocking loss of her mother in a car crash, 14 year old Amy (Anna Paquin), reluctantly moves from New Zealand to Canada to live with her estranged father (Jeff Daniels). Amy’s feelings of isolation are heightened by her father’s aloofness and preoccupation with his own inventions. Amy’s grief is allayed when she befriends a batch of goose eggs whose survival is threatened by the destruction of their natural habitat by developers. Amy becomes surrogate mother to the eggs, nursing them through to hatching. A problem develops when their surrogate mother must teach them how to fly south for the winter as part of their natural migration. The only solution seems to be for Amy to fly an ultralight plane, masquerading as the mother goose, to teach her ‘children’ to fly. Cast includes Anna Paquin, Jeff Daniels and Dana Delaney. Inspired by the true story of Bill Lishman who successfully found and raised a clutch of Canadian geese.

results.title: Mr Reliable: a true story
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Michael Hamlyn, Terry Hayes, Jim McElroy, State of Queensland, Hayes McElroy Productions, PolyGram Filmproduktion and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: In 1968, petty criminal Wally Melish (Colin Friels), earns himself the reputation of folk hero when he finds himself embroiled in an eight day siege with his girlfriend Beryl (Jacqueline McKenzie), after the police mistakenly think he has taken her hostage. The siege is marked by a marriage (between Wally and Beryl), and the media circus which captures the days events on national television. Based on a real event, cast includes Geoff Merrell, Neil Fitzpatrick, Lisa Hensley, Barry Otto and Paul Sonkkila.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nadia Tass, Michael Hamlyn, Terry Hayes, Jim McElroy, State of Queensland, Hayes McElroy Productions, PolyGram Filmproduktion and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: Labyrinth of passion = Laberinto de pasiones
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar and Alphaville S A
results.brief_description: Almodovar has taken the setting of Madrid as the centrepoint for this labyrinth of love, lust and passion. Sexilla the sex fiend is in love with Riza Niro, heir to a fallen Arab empire. Riza’s preoccupations are men and cosmetics. Set against a city of music, persecution, obsession and uncertain futures. Cast includes Antonio Banderas, Ceilia Roth, Imanol Arias and Fernando Vivanco. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Dark habits = entre tinieblas
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Luis Calvo, Tesauro S A and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Prepare to meet some nuns like you’ve never met before. Junkie nightclub singer Yolanda Bell (Christina S Pascual), takes refuge with the religious order ‘the humble redeemers’, after her boyfriend overdoses on heroin and Yolanda’s on the run from the police. ‘The humble redeemers’ are a good hearted group, trying to save girls from leading a wild life. They do however have a dark side to their operations; dealing drugs, dabbling in pornography and active chain smoking admirers of Cecil Barton. Together they are planning a party to celebrate Mother Superior’s name day; it will be a party to end all parties. Described as an evil twin of films such as ‘Sister act’ and ‘The Sound of music’, this film is Almodovar at his devilish and controversial best. Cast includes Julieta Serrano, Julia Marisa Paredes and Mary Carrillo. In Spanish with English subtitles.
